title: I've deleted LoL and won't return.
body:
**Toxic players have destroy this game**--one which I used to have so much fun playing. As mentioned, I've deleted the game (after spending over 500 on champs and skins) and I won't ever be coming back. 

As a person with high social anxiety, league was a sort of way for me to be around people without being around _too many_ people. But it's not like that anymore. I've grown _tired_ of the rampant toxicity that has grown unabated in this community. Chances are extremely high that someone will begin flaming in any given game I play, including games in which I am trying to introduce new players to League. And the extent to which these disgusting people are willing to go to make people feel bad is beyond reprehensible--**it's an outright condemnation of Riot's management of their own game and community**. 

Having expressed the aforethought, it's with no heavy heart that I say goodbye to League.

Ciao.

replies.body: If your anxiety is so intense that you struggle with verbal abuse in game, then you should probably see a doctor about that. I have pretty bad generalized anxiety but I'm able to somewhat control it. When I'm having days that it's particularly bad, I have medication for that. However, it still wouldn't hurt to talk to a doctor about things you can do to improve your situation.
I mean nothing prevents you from muting everyone as soon as the game starts, or even moving chat box offscreen.

True, I instantly mute people who show their toxicity in game. And I was so thankful when Riot implemented ping mutes. But the toxicity spreads from in game to after game, and nothing stops these people from continued attacks in the lobby or asking for false reports. Cheers!
False reports do nothing though. Like trying to turn a light switch on when it's already on, reports beyond the first are just people going through the motions without changing the results.

lul. Anytime anybody asks for a report, I pretty much always report them instead. It's against the rules to ask people to report others, after all. And, if it's any consolation, it doesn't really matter whether one person in a lobby reports you or 9 people. What matters is how many games you are reported over.

When I feel like I can't handle the toxicity, I use "/mute all" or "/fullmute all". If you haven't gotten rid of LoL completely yet, maybe give it a try?
{{sticker:slayer-pantheon-thumbs}}

It's a good suggestion, and did offer me some relief. But players find a way around it, like abuse in the end game lobby, or lying to players who havent muted them in order to get false reports. All sorts of things have happened. I appreciate the sincere response, though. Cheers :)

False reports mean nothing, and it doesn't matter how many people report someoneâ€”the system judges everyone in the match after a single report. So, muting them has no negative side effects as far as Riot is concerned.

Mystic Lyn had a good suggestion, too. You can also skip the loading screen altogether if you computer's not super fast. Heh. The benefits of old equipment.

After coming out of a game, i do my honor/reporting WHILE holding my hand over the chat box, post game is where i get the most toxicity. Although, my games seem rather toxin free, so i am lucky and grateful for that

if you can't handle toxicity than sadly the internet is not the place for you, and certainly not a game that requires the degree of teamwork necessary in league of legends. Such things inevitably lead to toxicity.
Getting you to quit the game and have a bad time is the goal of a troll. Out of 1/20 games I'll have a troll flaming me. Just play, report, and move on.

True, that is their goal. That, and to just generally make people feel bad. My goal was to have fun playing, and it just doesn't feel like I am anymore. And am particularly tired of getting out of a game and just feeling exhausted from the trolling. Cheers

Engaging in the trolling is a mistake.

You should take a break from League, definetly. You know this game isn't going to look at you funny for trying to redownload some other time in the future.
Bye.
o/
It has been a good while since I have seen anyone be really toxic in this game. Have you considered that maybe you are unknowingly perpetuating or amplifying the toxicity of your games?
I appreciate your generalized anecdote, but yes. I do consider my behavior in game and out of game. Best wishes.

You should probably take a break from League if it's starting to get unhealthy for you. Since you said you're suffering from anxiety, you should go see a psychiatrist and see what he/she can do and that you should also find another hobby that's healthy and can relieve you from your anxiety.

>I've deleted LoL and won't return.

They all say that.
lol is the wrong game to use as a social outlet. Its a high stress environment full of tilted players
play good=dont get flamed
